history.content: The faculty have not yet voted on the policy for students wanting to change their major to EECS. That's one of the pieces, like minors and honors, that hasn't yet been ironed out, but they hope to get those policies approved and distributed asap. The faculty are aware of your deadline. In CS, though, they are still using the grades you got for declaration purposes, even though you took them P/NP, and I suspect it could be the same for changing into EECS, so do keep working hard.

I'm currently in COE, but wanting to declare EECS as my major. I'm taking two of the pre-reqs right now, and was wondering if I'm allowed to p/np one of them as per the new grading policy for COE? And if so, how would my gpa declaration be calculated - would it be all the classes I took graded, or would they still use my grade in the class I p/np? 

Thanks!
history.subject: p/np for declaring eecs
